originalText.text: Perhaps the most unprofessional firm I have ever come across. Email me daily despite me asking frequently to be removed and constantly trying to block their reps and their domain. They seem to always find a way through. Avoid at all costs, the conferences are supposedly worthless.

text.text: Perhaps the most unprofessional firm I have ever come across. Email me daily despite me asking frequently to be removed and constantly trying to block their reps and their domain. They seem to always find a way through. Avoid at all costs, the conferences are supposedly worthless.

originalText.text: Argyle Executive Forum runs great conferences. I found them to be some of the most relevant and insightful forums out there. I have attended several of their marketing forums over the past 2 years. On each occasion, I have been very impressed with the quality of the speakers, panelists, as well as the other attendees. There’s no hard selling at Argyle events, which makes it a refreshing change from other conferences. At these events, no one is trying to sell you anything and the purpose is just to learn and to network. Additionally, Argyle events are free to attend. I have left every event with useful takeaways, and also several good business connections I made during the networking breaks. I’ve found their staff to be super-efficient and helpful, especially when I needed to find a private room to take an important phone call. I highly recommend Argyle’s events to senior-level business people who are eager to learn and make great business connections.

originalText.text: First rate events with high quality speakers and attendees. Has brought value to me and my organization in finding new partners and uncovering new opportunities. Thanks, Argyle!

originalText.text: They keep spamming my email despite numerous requests to stop.  Would highly advise not engaging their services or that of their sponsors.
